Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.585) (Phase 3)
